pageContext.claim: “Many of those affected were firefighters, police officers, and other first responders. And I was down there also, but I'm not considering myself a first responder. But I was down there. I spent a lot of time down there with you.”
pageContext.analysis: There is no evidence to support this claim. Reporters and government officials who either covered or participated in the post-9/11 clean-up say they have no memory of Trump spending "a lot of time" on the site. “I spent many months there myself, and I never witnessed him,” a retired deputy chief with the New York Fire Department, Richard Alles, told The New York Times.
